sect1.title: STEPPED

row.entry: The INDEX to sort. This can be filtered or the result of a PROJECT on an INDEX.
A comma-delimited list of fields by which to sort the result, typically trailing elements in the key.

sect1.para: The STEPPED function sorts the index by the specified fields. This function is used in those cases where the SORTED(index) function will not suffice.
There are some restrictions in its use:
The key fields before ordered fields should be reasonably well filtered, otherwise the sorting could become very memory intensive.
Roxie only supports sorting by trailing components on indexes that are read locally (single part indexes or superkeys containing single part indexes), or NOROOT indexes read within ALLNODES.
